identificationModule.briefTitle: Endometrial Cell Collection With the PadKit
identificationModule.officialTitle: Endometrial Cancer Cell Collection With the Preprogen PadKit™

descriptionModule.briefSummary: All patients will be provided with a Preprogen Pad to be worn for 4-6 hours to collect cells shed by the endometrium. After the kit is returned to the Preprogen laboratory, a brief survey will be completed. Analysis will be conducted to determine if the PadKit™ can collect a sample of endometrial cells sufficient to differentiate between normal and atypical hyperplasia/malignant cells in blinded samples provided to the laboratory for analysis.

armGroups.label: Biopsy proven hyperplasia/endometrial cancer with planned hysterectomy
armGroups.description: Women with biopsy proven hyperplasia/endometrial cancer with planned hysterectomy

armGroups.label: Benign clinical indications
armGroups.description: Women with planned hysterectomy for benign clinical indications

interventions.name: PadKit™ from Preprogen
interventions.description:
The interlabial pad is classified as a Class 1 device by the FDA and the device is exempt from requiring a 510(k) approval.

The interlabial pad is worn for 4-6 consecutive hours and collects cells shed from the cervix and uterine cavity. The pad is then removed and placed in the smaller, inner tube that contains the transport solution. After replacing the lid securely, it is then carefully placed back inside the larger outer tube with the outer lid secured and returned to the original box. The entire box is placed in the polybag and mailed back to the lab for analysis.
armGroupLabels: Biopsy proven hyperplasia/endometrial cancer with planned hysterectomy

primaryOutcomes.measure: Observation of the presence of endometrial cells captured by the pad.
primaryOutcomes.description: Direct observation of the absence or presence of endometrial cells on the pad by the pathologist
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 7 days after receipt of the pad from patients

primaryOutcomes.measure: Association of the presence/absence of cells and morphology
primaryOutcomes.description: Analysis for the presence of abnormal histology and morphological classification as normal, hyperplastic, or malignant.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 7 days after receipt of the pad from patients

secondaryOutcomes.description:
To determine patient preferences for using the interlabial PadKit™ vs current standard of care diagnostic tools including transvaginal ultrasound, endometrial biopsy, CT scan, and/or Dilation \& Curettage (D\&C).

Patient preferences regarding comfort of wearing the pad are captured using a 1-3 Likert scale with 1 being not comfortable and 3 being comfortable.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within the same day and after wearing the pad for 4-6 hours

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patient preferences - Simplicity of using the pad
secondaryOutcomes.description:
To determine patient preferences for using the interlabial PadKit™ vs current standard of care diagnostic tools including transvaginal ultrasound, endometrial biopsy, CT scan, and/or Dilation \& Curettage (D\&C).

Patient preferences regarding simplicity of using the pad are captured using a 4 Likert scale with 1 being not easy and 4 being very easy.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within the same day and after wearing the pad for 4-6 hours

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria

1. Women who present to Gynecologic Oncology for surgical intervention and have not undergone prior hysterectomy.

1. Cohort 1 has biopsy proven atypical hyperplasia or endometrial cancer.
2. Cohort 2 women with planned hysterectomy for benign clinical indications Exclusion criteria

   1. Unable to provide informed consent
   2. Women who have previously undergone uterine surgery (subtotal, or supracervical hysterectomy).
